snippet: Seemingly every year, violence intrudes on the margins of J’ouvert, a predawn carnival procession that precedes the West Indian American Day Parade.
abstract: Debate about whether festivities surrounding West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn were to blame for violence that left Carey Gabay, aide to Gov Andrew M Cuomo, critically wounded continues as Gabay remains in critical condition; organizers of parade and participants in predawn activities say violence, which officials say was due to warring gangs, has little to do with parade itself, which has been staged for more than decade without being interrupted by deadly violence.
lead_paragraph: Seemingly every year, violence intrudes on the margins of J’ouvert, a predawn carnival procession that precedes the West Indian American Day Parade.

headline.main: Violence Casts a Shadow Over J’ouvert Celebration in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: Violence Casts a Shadow Over a Celebration in Brooklyn
